thread.title: Area Sports: 3A Volleyball, youth football results
thread.title_full: Area Sports: 3A Volleyball, youth football results

author: Staff reports
title: Area Sports: 3A Volleyball, youth football results
text: Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 6:08 PM Updated at 6:10 PM Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 6:08 PM Updated at 6:10 PM 3A Volleyball playoffs Both Cleveland County qualifiers from the Big South Conference bowed out Saturday in the first round of the state playoffs. Kings Mountain suffered a 3-0 loss against visiting Saint Stephens with all three games going to the wire. The Mountaineers lost 25-23, 25-23 and 28-6 to see an 11-10 season come to an end. Crest up against a strong Marvin Ridge (21-3) squad and also fell 3-0. The Lady Chargers (10-9) were beaten 25-4, 25-8, 25-21 in the opening-round matchup. Shelby City Park Football Results Pee Wee League Jets 22, Giants 6 -- Izay Bridges had a 30-yard scoring run plus a conversion, with Andre Degree adding a 60-yard touchdown, Emanuelle Toms providing a 6-yard scoring run, and Micah Briscoe supplying a conversion for the Jets. Keylen Tate scored the lone Giantsâ€™ touchdown on a 5-yard run. Steelers 20, Falcons 0 -- David Johnson had touchdown runs of 30 and 5 yards for the Steelers with Camron Sanders a 50-yard scoring. The Steeler defense completed the scoring with a safety. Midget League Redskins 34, Vikings 6 -- Quay Johnson had a 20yard touchdown run and a 40-yard interception return for another score to pace the victors. Jarvis Ross contributed scoring runs of 60 and 11 yards for the Redskins, DaShawn Jones ran for a conversion and passed to Laden Ellis for another. Swint completed the scoring for the Redskins on an 11-yard run. C.J. Webber passed to Jamajah Patterson on a 70-yard scoring play for the Vikings. Panthers 26, Packers 0 -- Kendarious Hopper had touchdown dashes of 4 and 5 yards, and also connected with Christian Roseboro on a 75-yard scoring pass for the victors. Lamonte Allen chipped in with a 4-yard scoring run and a conversion for the Panthers. By Staff reports
